item.title: Beyond Scraping: How to Use Machine Learning When You're not Sure Where to Start
item.description:
Description

Scraping one web site for information is easy, scraping 10000 different sites is hard. Beyond page-specific scraping, how do you build a program than can extract the publication date of (almost) any news article online, no matter the web site? We’ll cover when to use machine learning vs. humans or heuristics for data extraction, the different steps of how to phrase the problem in terms of machine learning, including feature selection on HTML documents, and issues that arise when turning research into production code.Presenter(s): Speaker: Julie Lavoie
item.dc:creator: Julie Lavoie

item.title: Beyond scraping: how to use machine learning when you're not sure where to start
item.description:
Description

Scraping one web site for information is easy, scraping 10000 different sites is hard. Beyond page-specific scraping, how do you build a program than can extract the publication date of (almost) any news article online, no matter the web site?

We’ll cover when to use machine learning vs. humans or heuristics for data extraction, the different steps of how to phrase the problem in terms of machine learning, including feature selection on HTML documents, and issues that arise when turning research into production code.
item.dc:creator: Julie Lavoie

item.title: Hacker School
item.description:
Description

Montreal, Feb. 10, 2014 - Montreal artist and DJ Julie Lavoie shares her experience at Hacker School -- a unique writers' retreat for programmers in New York City.

Useful links:

  • Hacker School: https://www.hackerschool.com/
  • Julie: http://sflx.ca/jlavoie
  • MP43: http://montrealpython.org/fr/2014/02/mp43/
  • Montreal Python: http://montrealpython.org
  • Savoir-faire Linux: http://www.savoirfairelinux.com
item.dc:creator: Julie Lavoie

item.dc:creator: Julie Lavoie

item.title: How Soon is Now: extracting publication dates with machine learning
item.description:
Description

PyData SF 2016

Scraping New York Times articles for publication dates is easy, scraping 10 000 different sites is hard. Beyond page-specific scraping, how do you build a parser than can extract the publication date of (almost) any news article online, no matter what the site is? We implemented a research paper in machine learning to solve this problem, and talk about the challenges we faced.

We’ll cover when to use machine learning vs. humans or heuristics for data extraction, the different steps of how to phrase the problem in terms of machine learning, including feature selection on HTML documents, and issues that arise when turning research into production code. Data scientists and developers will leave knowing how to extract information from the web using new and more sophisticated techniques than simply writing a scraper.
item.dc:creator: Julie Lavoie

item.title: Analyzing Rap Lyrics with Python
item.description:
Summary

Have you ever wondered which rapper is the most sexist? Come learn how to find out by scraping rapgenius and analyzing rap lyrics using Python with libraries like pattern and Beautiful Soup! There will be pictures of Lil' Jon.
item.dc:creator: Julie Lavoie
